ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Playing a rogue
ygData.msgSnippet: You are making this sound, however, that melee classes are automatically given better weapons and armor at higher levels.  That is not always the case.  At
ygData.messageBody:
You are making this sound, however, that melee classes are automatically given better weapons and armor at higher levels.  That is not always the case.  At level 30, a rogue has trained any skills he can train until level 50.  He does NOT automatically get better gear every few levels.  If a rogue wants better gear he's gonna have to loot it or buy it.  So I do not necessarily think that equipment upgrades count in the overall scheme of things.  If I work mainly on xp and not for plat, I could potentially be using the same gear at level 50 as I was at level 30. 
 
Currently,  my rogue is level 35, and I'm beginning to see exactly where I need to upgrade equipment.  Particularly I need a better bow for archery.  And I need some + STA gear.  So I know what I need to work on.
 
Wulfric
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol)
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Thursday, March 20, 2003 1:59 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Playing a rogue

You forget one thing, you seem to complain that you don't get anything untill level 50. That's not the case, most meleers seems to forget that they do get their upgrades in form of weapons. If you didn't think your gear did a huge impact it's time to think again and start checking how to exp while gaining as good gear as possible during your lower levels. Check safehouse as someone else mentioned, that forum has all the info you need (don't forget the search function, people can get somewhat irritated on new people asking questions that has been asked 100 times in the past few days =P).
 
-domi
-----Original Message-----
From: Wulfric Rennison [mailto:wulftech@...]
Sent: den 19 mars 2003 23:30
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Playing a rogue

Perhaps you people can help me.  This is something I've pondered for awhile.
 
My rogue is level 32.  I play him infrequently.  At level 30 rogues get all the skills they are going to get.  Rogues are non-casters so they don't have new spells to look forward to.  The only things rogues have to look forward to are their disciplines at level 50.  So how does one get from level 30 to level 50 in the shortest amount of time possible?  Whenever I play, it seems like I always have a hard time finding a group.  I'm looking in places like Frontier Mountains, The Overthere, and Dawnshroud Peaks.  I'm not high enough level that I can easily solo any mobs in either of those zones. But nobody seems to want to group.  So are there any zones where I can get quick xp by soloing?  Or are there other zones I could try for groups? 
 
I hate for my rogue to fall by the way side because he's become a bore to play.  So any suggestions you have for playing rogue characters to help me out would be appreciated.
 
Thanks in advance.
 
Wulfric Rennison
32 Half Elf Rogue
Cazic Thule server
